group5

Class Clothing

  • java.lang.Object
    • group5.Clothing
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Comparable<Clothing>

    public class Clothing
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Comparable<Clothing>, java.io.Serializable
    This class holds all the methods and constructor in charge of making one article of clothing. the singular piece of clothing has 4 attributes: Name, Size, Fabric, Price. Getters and setters for all the fields are included with equals, hash code, compareTo, and toString.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      Constructor and Description
      Clothing(java.lang.String name, java.lang.String fabric, java.lang.String size, double cost)
      Creates a new article of clothing with a name, fabric, size, and cost.

      provides access to the name of clothing, we are only returning the name because the combo box in clothingView automatically toStrings the clothing that's in it as the display name of the clothing when they are held inside the combo box.

      • compareTo

        public int compareTo(Clothing o)
        compares the name of two pieces of clothing. This isn't used much in the program besides for Collection.sort().
        Specified by:
        compareTo in interface java.lang.Comparable<Clothing>
        Parameters:

        Returns:
